course.subject: LANG
course.name: Foundation in Listening & Speaking for Postgraduate Students
course.description: For students whose level of spoken English is lower than ELPA Level 4 (Speaking) when they enter the University. The course addresses the immediate linguistic needs of research postgraduate students for oral communication on campus using English. To complete the course, students are required to attain at least ELPA Level 4 (Speaking). Graded P or F.

reviews.author: Max Prior
reviews.title: ELPA Speaking Test (RPG)
reviews.comment_content:
Assessment of oral skills in English based on a eight minute conversation.

In the first part, a topic is introduced and you are asked related questions. The answers can be answered briefly in about 30 seconds.

Example:
What are some of the most popular sports in your country/Hong Kong? (Possible follow-up: Do you play any of these?)

In the second part, you are given a problem and you are asked to discuss it by speaking two minutes. Before answering, you have one minute prepare.

Example:
In some countries the police are often as corrupt as the criminals. What are the solutions to this problem?
Follow Up
- Which is the best solution?
- Would most people agree with your solution? - Would your solution(s) work?

Important here is not to question the problem itself, but to come up with possible solutions.
reviews.comment_teaching: The assessor was friendly and supportive. The instructions given were clear and understandable.
reviews.comment_grading:
The assessment is graded either pass or fail. To pass at least 4 out of 7 points need to be obtained in each of the following areas:

Topic development and coherence:
You can speak for a long time and usually in a well-organised way.  Sometimes when you hesitate, you seem to be searching for words or structures; at other times it seems quite natural.  
You use a range of connectives, although you may make errors.
You may use too many fillers (e.g., ‘you know’, ‘like’).

Vocabulary range and accuracy:
You use an adequate range of vocabulary to talk about a given topic. You might repeat words and phrases. You may quite often choose the wrong word or the wrong form of a word, especially if you are a risk-taker and like to try out new words and phrases, but this rarely affects other people’s understanding of your message.

Grammar range and accuracy:
You use both simple structures and complex structures. You might repeat particular structures. You may quite often make mistakes, especially if you are a risk-taker and like to try out different structures, but this rarely   affects other people’s understanding of your message.

Pronunciation:
You pronounce most sounds and words correctly, and on the whole your pronunciation does not cause difficulties for the listener. You mostly use rhythm and intonation appropriately.

The description below each area corresponds to requirements to achieve 4 points.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload depends strongly on your general level of English:

I believe that for natives, and for non-natives who lived in an English speaking country there is little need to prepare.

For intermediate English speakers I would recommend the following:

Think of phrases to express you opinion (e. g. I believe, from my point of view, in my opinion) and a variety of words to link your sentences. Try to practice them beforehand such that you sound naturally.

Practice the discussion of a problem. Use a timer to track your preparation time and your speaking time.

reviews.author: Chao
reviews.title: Good class
reviews.comment_content: Good for everyone There will be some connections but it will not force you to do it, but doing it will help you more and it will be better to pass the  exam
reviews.comment_teaching: The correct pronunciation is in place. Almost everyone speaks in turn in class and everyone speaks.
reviews.comment_grading: Almost everyone in the class passed, as long as you prepare for elpa, there is no problem.
reviews.comment_workload: There will be some connections but it will not force you to do it, but doing it will help you more and it will be better to pass the  exam

reviews.author: wholovescougar
reviews.comment_content:
1. Use more accurate pronunciation and more appropriate features of connected speech for effective communication.

2. Express views about academic and social topics with more appropriate topic development and coherence.

3. Show progress in their skills in listening for features in English texts to improve their own development of speaking skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teacher is nice but sometimes he was quite lazy in teaching, while it is fine.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is only Pass or Fail. Most of the students pass this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Write one learning progress and prepare a video. If you pass the first ELPA test (mid-term test), you will not required to join the class.

reviews.author: Eric Haha
reviews.comment_content:
some topics are interesting
For students whose level of spoken English is lower than ELPA Level 4 (Speaking) when they enter the University. The course addresses the immediate linguistic needs of research postgraduate students for oral communication on campus using English. To complete the course, students are required to attain at least ELPA Level 4 (Speaking). Graded P or F.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teachers were nice and the final exam was easy
reviews.comment_grading: most students of the class can pass it，Just finish your homework on time

reviews.author: joeyyyy
reviews.title: 老师很nice
reviews.comment_content: Ivy 人美心善对大家都很好
reviews.comment_teaching: 纠正发音很到位，课堂上几乎都是轮流发言，大家都会开口
reviews.comment_grading: 班上的几乎都pass了，只要好好准备elpa就没有问题。
reviews.comment_workload: 会有一些联系但是不会强制你做，但是做了会对自己的帮助比较大，也会比较好通过elpa考试
